basis: User explicitly commits to several concrete actions (water, box breathing, snack, log cravings, walk if cravings) and plans to check in later; tone is proactive and aligned with the coach's steps.
cognitive_dissonance: Low-level tension between wanting to avoid overeating and cravings, but mitigated by a structured plan and permission to adjust; appears resolved by committing to small, actionable steps.
negative_thought_patterns: Mild anticipatory worry about heat impacting willpower; some perfectionism tendencies, yet tempered by language of adjustment and ease.
emotional_triggers: Heat-induced discomfort, cravings, cues to snack; emphasis on hydration and shade to reduce stress.
effective_reinforcement: Plan to log urges and check in
coaching_notes: Keep plans brief and actionable; consider adding explicit cue-based strategies (e.g., if craving, then do 2 minutes of box breathing) and encourage a quick, scheduled check-in to reinforce accountability. Emphasize hydration and environmental adjustments to support adherence.
